research_field.en: Magnetism, superconductivity, and strongly correlated systems

affiliation.ja: 東北大学 金属材料研究所
affiliation.en: Tohoku University Institute for Materials Research

paper_title.en: Repulsive flux pinning force in NbTi/Nb superconductor/superconductor multilayers

description.en: Flux pinning characteristics have been investigated for the Nb-x Ti100-x/Nb (x = 65, 50 and 28) and Nb28Ti72/Nb65Ti35 superconductor(S)/superconductor( S') multilayers. The maximum of the pinning force F-pperpendicular tomax perpendicular to the layer plane as a function of the structure modulation length lambda has a peak in the quasi-two-dimensional region (lambdasimilar to20 nm). The maximum. values of the F-pperpendicular tomax versus lambda curve are proportional to the difference of the GL coherence length (xiGL) between the superconductive sublayers S and S'. The results suggest that the large F-pperpendicular tomax in the S/S' multilayer is caused by the repulsive pinning force due to Nb layers with larger xiGL.

paper_title.en: Repulsive flux pinning force in NbTi/Nb superconductor/superconductor multilayers

description.en: Flux pinning characteristics have been investigated for the Nb-x Ti100-x/Nb (x = 65, 50 and 28) and Nb28Ti72/Nb65Ti35 superconductor(S)/superconductor( S') multilayers. The results suggest that the large F-pperpendicular tomax in the S/S' multilayer is caused by the repulsive pinning force due to Nb layers with larger xiGL.

paper_title.en: Specific heat of amorphous Mn100-xCex alloys

description.en: We have measured the specific heat C-p on sputtered amorphous Mn100-xCex alloys for 25 less than or equal to x less than or equal to 79 from 4.2 to 300 K using a light-chopped AC method. The C-p/T follows gamma + AT(2) law below 15 K in each Ce concentration. The gamma value increases systematically as a function of x and reaches 0.124 J/mol K-2 for x = 79, suggesting formation of a dense-Kondo and/or heavy-fermion state at low temperature for the Ce-rich side. Large magnetic contribution in C, has been observed at higher temperature, suggesting existence of large itinerant spin fluctuations. (C) 2003 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

publication_name.en: JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS

paper_title.ja: Evidence for Zero and π phase from Superconducting Transition Temperature in Nb/Co Superconducting Multilayers
paper_title.en: Evidence for zero and pi phase from superconducting transition temperature in Nb/Co superconducting multilayers

description.en: The oscillating phenomena of T-c as a function of ferromagnetic layer thickness have been observed for both the Nb/Co superconductor(S)/ferromagnet(F) tri-layer series (F/S/F) and penta-layer series (F/S/F/S/F). The oscillating characteristics are different between tri-layer and penta-layer, reflecting the 0-phase and pi-phase forming of neighboring S-layers, which provides a first evidence of T-c oscillation distinguishing both the phases. (C) 2003 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

publication_name.en: JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS

paper_title.ja: Electrical Transport and Optical Properties of Hydrogen Deficient YH2 Films

paper_title.en: Electrical Transport and Optical Properties of Hydrogen Deficient YH2 Films

description.en: The MnN compound is prepared as a single phase by d.c. reactive sputtering. The crystal structure of MnN is tetragonally distorted NaCl type (fct) one. The temperature variation of lattice constants for MnN is measured by X-ray diffraction experiments in the temperature range from 289 to 803 K. It is found that the MnN compound shows anomalous thermal expansion and the crystal structure of MnN has changed from fct structure to fcc one at about 650 K. On the other hand, we found formerly that MnN was an antiferromagnetic compound with a Neel temperature of 650 K. The tetragonal distortion below about 650 K is well explained by the strain dependence of the exchange interaction on the basis of molecular field theory. (C) 2003 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

The MnN compound is prepared as a single phase by d.c. reactive sputtering. The crystal structure of MnN is tetragonally distorted NaCl type (fct) one. The temperature variation of lattice constants for MnN is measured by X-ray diffraction experiments in the temperature range from 289 to 803 K. It is found that the MnN compound shows anomalous thermal expansion and the crystal structure of MnN has changed from fct structure to fcc one at about 650 K. On the other hand, we found formerly that MnN was an antiferromagnetic compound with a Neel temperature of 650 K. The tetragonal distortion below about 650 K is well explained by the strain dependence of the exchange interaction on the basis of molecular field theory. (C) 2003 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Magnetic properties of amorphous Mn100-xCex alloys

description.en: We have measured the magnetization and thermal expansion coefficient alpha on sputtered amorphous Mn100-xCex alloys in various concentrations of Ce. In Mn-rich samples we observe a small anomaly and thermal hysteresis between field-cooling and zero-field-cooling in the low-temperature magnetization, suggesting a spin-glass ordering, and an anomalously large alpha value with normal Debye-like temperature dependence. In Ce-rich samples we observe typical Curie-Weiss behavior in the magnetization, but alpha increases with the decrease of temperature below 100 K, suggesting the significant contribution of the Ce 4f electrons to the thermal expansion. (C) 2002 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Pauli paramagnetic effect and spin-orbit scattering time in Nb/Al2O3 superconducting multilayers

description.en: The parallel critical field H(c2)parallel to(T) of the Nb/Al2O3 two-dimensional (2D) multilayer superconductors has been analyzed by developing the 2D-version of the WHH theory and by utilizing the Takahashi-Tachiki formalism. A reliable method to estimate the spin-orbit scattering time tau(S0) of thin films has been provided. (C) 2003 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: NMR spectra of Co-59 and N-14 in CoN

description.en: Nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR) measurements of Co-59 and N-14 in CoN with a zincblende type structure were carried out in the temperature range from 4.2K to room temperature. NMR Spectra of Co-59 are obtained from Free Induction Decay (FID) signals in a static field of 6.3068 T. NMR Spectra of N-14 are obtained by spin-echo method in the same static field. The temperature variations of Knight shifts are derived from resonance peak positions at various temperatures. In this experiment, it is found that the temperature variations of Knight shifts are very small. Therefore, it is concluded that the compound CoN has Pauli paramagnetism. This is consistent with the result of the temperature-independent susceptibility.

publication_name.en: JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN

paper_title.en: Dense Kondo-like behavior in electric resistivity of amorphous Mn100-xCex alloy

description.en: Binary amorphous alloy system Mn100-xCex has been fabricated by a dc-sputtering deposition with various Ce compositions ranging from x = 20 to 80. Temperature dependence of electrical resistivity for Ce-rich side of amorphous Mn100-xCex alloy, especially in Mn21Ce79, exhibits a large initial increase with T-2-like behavior at low temperature side up to about 7 K followed by a quite rapid logarithmic-like decrease with the increase of temperature. In contrast, amorphous Mn75Ce25 alloy shows only monotonic decrease in the resistivity with increasing temperature. These results reveal a clear evidence of a dense Kondo behavior for Ce rich side.

paper_title.en: Dense Kondo-like behavior in electric resistivity of amorphous Mn100-xCex alloy

description.en: Binary amorphous alloy system Mn100-xCex has been fabricated by a dc-sputtering deposition with various Ce compositions ranging from x = 20 to 80. Temperature dependence of electrical resistivity for Ce-rich side of amorphous Mn100-xCex alloy, especially in Mn21Ce79, exhibits a large initial increase with T-2-like behavior at low temperature side up to about 7 K followed by a quite rapid logarithmic-like decrease with the increase of temperature. In contrast, amorphous Mn75Ce25 alloy shows only monotonic decrease in the resistivity with increasing temperature. These results reveal a clear evidence of a dense Kondo behavior for Ce rich side.

paper_title.en: Synthetic analyses of T-c and H-c2 of NbTi/Nb superconductor/superconductor superlattice

description.en: Based on an improved calculation formalism of the proximity effect, the transition temperature T-c, the parallel (H-c2 parallel to) and perpendicular (H-c2 perpendicular to) critical fields of the Nb50Ti50/Nb superlattice have been analyzed as a function of the structural modulation wavelength lambda (s). T-c, H-c2 parallel to and H-c2 perpendicular to have been calculated using a unified set of the material parameters and allowing for the transition of the center of the order parameter between the NbTi and Nb layers. The calculation has systematically reproduced the characteristics of H-c2 parallel to and H-c2 perpendicular to including the two-step dimensional crossover of H-c2 parallel to(T) and the anomalous upward curvature of H-c2 perpendicular to(T).

paper_title.en: Synthetic analyses of T-c and H-c2 of NbTi/Nb superconductor/superconductor superlattice

description.en: Based on an improved calculation formalism of the proximity effect, the transition temperature T-c, the parallel (H-c2 parallel to) and perpendicular (H-c2 perpendicular to) critical fields of the Nb50Ti50/Nb superlattice have been analyzed as a function of the structural modulation wavelength lambda (s).
